p: The M. citriodora essential oils were obtained as clear orange oils. The essential oil yields for M. citriodora aerial parts essential oil were 1.59% and 1.79% for samples #1 and #2, respectively, while the root essential oil was obtained in 0.879% yield. The chemical compositions of the essential oils from the aerial parts and the roots of M. citriodora cultivated in south Alabama are summarized in Table 1. The essential oils were dominated by the phenolic monoterpenoids thymol (RI db = 1289) and carvacrol (RI db = 1296). The other major components were p-cymene (RI db = 1024) and thymol methyl ether (RI db = 1239).
